result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Hohm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for victim T.R. for case 14CF1274 which was dismissed and read-in to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before any costs/fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign any releases for agent.
Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Attend 2 self-help meetins per week. Attend Criminal Thinking and Cognitive Thinking courses.
Comply with Day Report Center for 90 days. Consecutive to condition time.

No Contact with anyone listed in the criminal complaints or any co-defendants. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for 90 days of Day Report Center.

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes statements regarding sentencing.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1: IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERMS OF PROBATION -  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION - 
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
          prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:  anyone listed in criminal complaints or any Co-Defendants 
____Criminal Thinking course, Cognitive Thinking course
____2 self-help meetings per week  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____90 Days Day Report Center, consecutive to condition time 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

RESTITUTION:  $119.00 to victim Thomas Rust on Case #14CF1274 (restitution to be paid before fines/costs)

CONDITION TIME:  6 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - for 90 Days Day Report Center 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
